comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: There was a larger seam of gold in the mine but it had to be broken up to be brought to the surface. The world's largest nugget of pure gold is still the Welcome Stranger, found in Moliagul, Victoria, Australia on 5 February 1869
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 84137472@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] 
Wasn't the "Welcome Stranger" the largest alluvial piece of gold (72kg), where as this was the largest reef gold nugget at 145kg.

comment.author: 84137472@N05
comment._content: PS. my great great grandfather ran the crusher that processed this nugget, my understanding was a plaster cast was made of the nugget before it was crushed and that is what was used in Merlin's photo.
